page.title: 17POPULATION:WOODTON PARISH
page.content: About 30% of the people here belong to families who have lived in the area for 2 or more generations.Perhaps because of this,social divisions are not strongly marked.There are farmers, several professionals,some retired, several self-employed & little real poverty. In 1981 there were 491 people;238 male & 253 female.Of these 8% were under 5, 17% were 5-16,58% were between 16 & 64,11% were 65-75 & 4% were 75 or more; the oldest resid- ent is 94.These numbers compare with a total population of 477 in 1881,with 37% being under 16,of which 1/3 were under 5.A recent fall in the numbers of children is causing local concern because Norfolk C.C. is reviewing its policy of school closure; looking at schools with numbers below 100.People feel strongly that their village sch- ool is a vital part of the community.
